  31. ‌static Status IOError(const std::string& context, int err_number) {
  32.   return Status::IOError(context, strerror(err_number));
  33. }

  35. class PosixSequentialFile: public SequentialFile {
  36. private:
  37.   std::string filename_;
  38.   FILE* file_;

  40. public:
  41. ‌  PosixSequentialFile(const std::string& fname, FILE* f)
  42.       : filename_(fname), file_(f) { }
  43. ‌  virtual ~PosixSequentialFile() { fclose(file_); }

  45. ‌  virtual Status Read(size_t n, Slice* result, char* scratch) {
  46.     Status s;
  47.     size_t r = fread_unlocked(scratch, 1, n, file_);
  48.     *result = Slice(scratch, r);
  49.     if (r < n) {
  50.       if (feof(file_)) {
  51.         // We leave status as ok if we hit the end of the file
  52.       } else {
  53.         // A partial read with an error: return a non-ok status
  54.         s = IOError(filename_, errno);
  55.       }
  56.     }
  57.     return s;
  58.   }

  60. ‌  virtual Status Skip(uint64_t n) {
  61.     if (fseek(file_, n, SEEK_CUR)) {
  62.       return IOError(filename_, errno);
  63.     }
  64.     return Status::OK();
  65.   }
  66. };

  68. // pread() based random-access
  69. class PosixRandomAccessFile: public RandomAccessFile {
  70. private:
  71.   std::string filename_;
  72.   int fd_;

  74. public:
  75. ‌  PosixRandomAccessFile(const std::string& fname, int fd)
  76.       : filename_(fname), fd_(fd) { }
  77. ‌  virtual ~PosixRandomAccessFile() { close(fd_); }

  79. ‌  virtual Status Read(uint64_t offset, size_t n, Slice* result,
  80.                       char* scratch) const {
  81.     Status s;
  82.     ssize_t r = pread(fd_, scratch, n, static_cast<off_t>(offset));
  83.     *result = Slice(scratch, (r < 0) ? 0 : r);
  84.     if (r < 0) {
  85.       // An error: return a non-ok status
  86.       s = IOError(filename_, errno);
  87.     }
  88.     return s;
  89.   }
  90. };

  92. // Helper class to limit mmap file usage so that we do not end up
  93. // running out virtual memory or running into kernel performance
  94. // problems for very large databases.
  95. class MmapLimiter {
  96. public:
  97.   // Up to 1000 mmaps for 64-bit binaries; none for smaller pointer sizes.
  98. ‌  MmapLimiter() {
  99.     SetAllowed(sizeof(void*) >= 8 ? 1000 : 0);
  100.   }

  102.   // If another mmap slot is available, acquire it and return true.
  103.   // Else return false.
  104. ‌  bool Acquire() {
  105.     if (GetAllowed() <= 0) {
  106.       return false;
  107.     }
  108.     MutexLock l(&mu_);
  109.     intptr_t x = GetAllowed();
  110.     if (x <= 0) {
  111.       return false;
  112.     } else {
  113.       SetAllowed(x - 1);
  114.       return true;
  115.     }
  116.   }

  118.   // Release a slot acquired by a previous call to Acquire() that returned true.
  119. ‌  void Release() {
  120.     MutexLock l(&mu_);
  121.     SetAllowed(GetAllowed() + 1);
  122.   }

  124. private:
  125.   port::Mutex mu_;
  126.   port::AtomicPointer allowed_;

  128. ‌  intptr_t GetAllowed() const {
  129.     return reinterpret_cast<intptr_t>(allowed_.Acquire_Load());
  130.   }

  132.   // REQUIRES: mu_ must be held
  133. ‌  void SetAllowed(intptr_t v) {
  134.     allowed_.Release_Store(reinterpret_cast<void*>(v));
  135.   }

  137.   MmapLimiter(const MmapLimiter&);
  138.   void operator=(const MmapLimiter&);
  139. };

  141. // mmap() based random-access
  142. class PosixMmapReadableFile: public RandomAccessFile {
  143. private:
  144.   std::string filename_;
  145.   void* mmapped_region_;
  146.   size_t length_;
  147.   MmapLimiter* limiter_;

  149. public:
  150.   // base[0,length-1] contains the mmapped contents of the file.
  151. ‌  PosixMmapReadableFile(const std::string& fname, void* base, size_t length,
  152.                         MmapLimiter* limiter)
  153.       : filename_(fname), mmapped_region_(base), length_(length),
  154.         limiter_(limiter) {
  155.   }

  157. ‌  virtual ~PosixMmapReadableFile() {
  158.     munmap(mmapped_region_, length_);
  159.     limiter_->Release();
  160.   }

  162. ‌  virtual Status Read(uint64_t offset, size_t n, Slice* result,
  163.                       char* scratch) const {
  164.     Status s;
  165.     if (offset + n > length_) {
  166.       *result = Slice();
  167.       s = IOError(filename_, EINVAL);
  168.     } else {
  169.       *result = Slice(reinterpret_cast<char*>(mmapped_region_) + offset, n);
  170.     }
  171.     return s;
  172.   }
  173. };

  175. class PosixWritableFile : public WritableFile {
  176. private:
  177.   std::string filename_;
  178.   FILE* file_;

  180. public:
  181. ‌  PosixWritableFile(const std::string& fname, FILE* f)
  182.       : filename_(fname), file_(f) { }

  184. ‌  ~PosixWritableFile() {
  185.     if (file_ != NULL) {
  186.       // Ignoring any potential errors
  187.       fclose(file_);
  188.     }
  189.   }

  191. ‌  virtual Status Append(const Slice& data) {
  192.     size_t r = fwrite_unlocked(data.data(), 1, data.size(), file_);
  193.     if (r != data.size()) {
  194.       return IOError(filename_, errno);
  195.     }
  196.     return Status::OK();
  197.   }

  199. ‌  virtual Status Close() {
  200.     Status result;
  201.     if (fclose(file_) != 0) {
  202.       result = IOError(filename_, errno);
  203.     }
  204.     file_ = NULL;
  205.     return result;
  206.   }

  208. ‌  virtual Status Flush() {
  209.     if (fflush_unlocked(file_) != 0) {
  210.       return IOError(filename_, errno);
  211.     }
  212.     return Status::OK();
  213.   }

  215. ‌  Status SyncDirIfManifest() {
  216.     const char* f = filename_.c_str();
  217.     const char* sep = strrchr(f, '/');
  218.     Slice basename;
  219.     std::string dir;
  220.     if (sep == NULL) {
  221.       dir = ".";
  222.       basename = f;
  223.     } else {
  224.       dir = std::string(f, sep - f);
  225.       basename = sep + 1;
  226.     }
  227.     Status s;
  228.     if (basename.starts_with("MANIFEST")) {
  229.       int fd = open(dir.c_str(), O_RDONLY);
  230.       if (fd < 0) {
  231.         s = IOError(dir, errno);
  232.       } else {
  233.         if (fsync(fd) < 0) {
  234.           s = IOError(dir, errno);
  235.         }
  236.         close(fd);
  237.       }
  238.     }
  239.     return s;
  240.   }

  242. ‌  virtual Status Sync() {
  243.     // Ensure new files referred to by the manifest are in the filesystem.
  244.     Status s = SyncDirIfManifest();
  245.     if (!s.ok()) {
  246.       return s;
  247.     }
  248.     if (fflush_unlocked(file_) != 0 ||
  249.         fdatasync(fileno(file_)) != 0) {
  250.       s = Status::IOError(filename_, strerror(errno));
  251.     }
  252.     return s;
  253.   }
  254. };

  256. ‌static int LockOrUnlock(int fd, bool lock) {
  257.   errno = 0;
  258.   struct flock f;
  259.   memset(&f, 0, sizeof(f));
  260.   f.l_type = (lock ? F_WRLCK : F_UNLCK);
  261.   f.l_whence = SEEK_SET;
  262.   f.l_start = 0;
  263.   f.l_len = 0;        // Lock/unlock entire file
  264.   return fcntl(fd, F_SETLK, &f);
  265. }

  267. class PosixFileLock : public FileLock {
  268. public:
  269.   int fd_;
  270.   std::string name_;
  271. };

  273. // Set of locked files.  We keep a separate set instead of just
  274. // relying on fcntrl(F_SETLK) since fcntl(F_SETLK) does not provide
  275. // any protection against multiple uses from the same process.
  276. class PosixLockTable {
  277. private:
  278.   port::Mutex mu_;
  279.   std::set<std::string> locked_files_;
  280. public:
  281. ‌  bool Insert(const std::string& fname) {
  282.     MutexLock l(&mu_);
  283.     return locked_files_.insert(fname).second;
  284.   }
  285. ‌  void Remove(const std::string& fname) {
  286.     MutexLock l(&mu_);
  287.     locked_files_.erase(fname);
  288.   }
  289. };

  291. class PosixEnv : public Env {
  292. public:
  293.   PosixEnv();
  294. ‌  virtual ~PosixEnv() {
  295.     char msg[] = "Destroying Env::Default()\n";
  296.     fwrite(msg, 1, sizeof(msg), stderr);
  297.     abort();
  298.   }

  300. ‌  virtual Status NewSequentialFile(const std::string& fname,
  301.                                    SequentialFile** result) {
  302.     FILE* f = fopen(fname.c_str(), "r");
  303.     if (f == NULL) {
  304.       *result = NULL;
  305.       return IOError(fname, errno);
  306.     } else {
  307.       *result = new PosixSequentialFile(fname, f);
  308.       return Status::OK();
  309.     }
  310.   }

  312. ‌  virtual Status NewRandomAccessFile(const std::string& fname,
  313.                                      RandomAccessFile** result) {
  314.     *result = NULL;
  315.     Status s;
  316.     int fd = open(fname.c_str(), O_RDONLY);
  317.     if (fd < 0) {
  318.       s = IOError(fname, errno);
  319.     } else if (mmap_limit_.Acquire()) {
  320.       uint64_t size;
  321.       s = GetFileSize(fname, &size);
  322.       if (s.ok()) {
  323.         void* base = mmap(NULL, size, PROT_READ, MAP_SHARED, fd, 0);
  324.         if (base != MAP_FAILED) {
  325.           *result = new PosixMmapReadableFile(fname, base, size, &mmap_limit_);
  326.         } else {
  327.           s = IOError(fname, errno);
  328.         }
  329.       }
  330.       close(fd);
  331.       if (!s.ok()) {
  332.         mmap_limit_.Release();
  333.       }
  334.     } else {
  335.       *result = new PosixRandomAccessFile(fname, fd);
  336.     }
  337.     return s;
  338.   }

  340. ‌  virtual Status NewWritableFile(const std::string& fname,
  341.                                  WritableFile** result) {
  342.     Status s;
  343.     FILE* f = fopen(fname.c_str(), "w");
  344.     if (f == NULL) {
  345.       *result = NULL;
  346.       s = IOError(fname, errno);
  347.     } else {
  348.       *result = new PosixWritableFile(fname, f);
  349.     }
  350.     return s;
  351.   }

  353. ‌  virtual bool FileExists(const std::string& fname) {
  354.     return access(fname.c_str(), F_OK) == 0;
  355.   }

  357. ‌  virtual Status GetChildren(const std::string& dir,
  358.                              std::vector<std::string>* result) {
  359.     result->clear();
  360.     DIR* d = opendir(dir.c_str());
  361.     if (d == NULL) {
  362.       return IOError(dir, errno);
  363.     }
  364.     struct dirent* entry;
  365.     while ((entry = readdir(d)) != NULL) {
  366.       result->push_back(entry->d_name);
  367.     }
  368.     closedir(d);
  369.     return Status::OK();
  370.   }

  372. ‌  virtual Status DeleteFile(const std::string& fname) {
  373.     Status result;
  374.     if (unlink(fname.c_str()) != 0) {
  375.       result = IOError(fname, errno);
  376.     }
  377.     return result;
  378.   }

  380. ‌  virtual Status CreateDir(const std::string& name) {
  381.     Status result;
  382.     if (mkdir(name.c_str(), 0755) != 0) {
  383.       result = IOError(name, errno);
  384.     }
  385.     return result;
  386.   }

  388. ‌  virtual Status DeleteDir(const std::string& name) {
  389.     Status result;
  390.     if (rmdir(name.c_str()) != 0) {
  391.       result = IOError(name, errno);
  392.     }
  393.     return result;
  394.   }

  396. ‌  virtual Status GetFileSize(const std::string& fname, uint64_t* size) {
  397.     Status s;
  398.     struct stat sbuf;
  399.     if (stat(fname.c_str(), &sbuf) != 0) {
  400.       *size = 0;
  401.       s = IOError(fname, errno);
  402.     } else {
  403.       *size = sbuf.st_size;
  404.     }
  405.     return s;
  406.   }

  408. ‌  virtual Status RenameFile(const std::string& src, const std::string& target) {
  409.     Status result;
  410.     if (rename(src.c_str(), target.c_str()) != 0) {
  411.       result = IOError(src, errno);
  412.     }
  413.     return result;
  414.   }

  416. ‌  virtual Status LockFile(const std::string& fname, FileLock** lock) {
  417.     *lock = NULL;
  418.     Status result;
  419.     int fd = open(fname.c_str(), O_RDWR | O_CREAT, 0644);
  420.     if (fd < 0) {
  421.       result = IOError(fname, errno);
  422.     } else if (!locks_.Insert(fname)) {
  423.       close(fd);
  424.       result = Status::IOError("lock " + fname, "already held by process");
  425.     } else if (LockOrUnlock(fd, true) == -1) {
  426.       result = IOError("lock " + fname, errno);
  427.       close(fd);
  428.       locks_.Remove(fname);
  429.     } else {
  430.       PosixFileLock* my_lock = new PosixFileLock;
  431.       my_lock->fd_ = fd;
  432.       my_lock->name_ = fname;
  433.       *lock = my_lock;
  434.     }
  435.     return result;
  436.   }

  438. ‌  virtual Status UnlockFile(FileLock* lock) {
  439.     PosixFileLock* my_lock = reinterpret_cast<PosixFileLock*>(lock);
  440.     Status result;
  441.     if (LockOrUnlock(my_lock->fd_, false) == -1) {
  442.       result = IOError("unlock", errno);
  443.     }
  444.     locks_.Remove(my_lock->name_);
  445.     close(my_lock->fd_);
  446.     delete my_lock;
  447.     return result;
  448.   }

  450.   virtual void Schedule(void (*function)(void*), void* arg);

  452.   virtual void StartThread(void (*function)(void* arg), void* arg);

  454. ‌  virtual Status GetTestDirectory(std::string* result) {
  455.     const char* env = getenv("TEST_TMPDIR");
  456.     if (env && env[0] != '\0') {
  457.       *result = env;
  458.     } else {
  459.       char buf[100];
  460.       snprintf(buf, sizeof(buf), "/tmp/leveldbtest-%d", int(geteuid()));
  461.       *result = buf;
  462.     }
  463.     // Directory may already exist
  464.     CreateDir(*result);
  465.     return Status::OK();
  466.   }

  468. ‌  static uint64_t gettid() {
  469.     pthread_t tid = pthread_self();
  470.     uint64_t thread_id = 0;
  471.     memcpy(&thread_id, &tid, std::min(sizeof(thread_id), sizeof(tid)));
  472.     return thread_id;
  473.   }

  475. ‌  virtual Status NewLogger(const std::string& fname, Logger** result) {
  476.     FILE* f = fopen(fname.c_str(), "w");
  477.     if (f == NULL) {
  478.       *result = NULL;
  479.       return IOError(fname, errno);
  480.     } else {
  481.       *result = new PosixLogger(f, &PosixEnv::gettid);
  482.       return Status::OK();
  483.     }
  484.   }

  486. ‌  virtual uint64_t NowMicros() {
  487.     struct timeval tv;
  488.     gettimeofday(&tv, NULL);
  489.     return static_cast<uint64_t>(tv.tv_sec) * 1000000 + tv.tv_usec;
  490.   }

  492. ‌  virtual void SleepForMicroseconds(int micros) {
  493.     usleep(micros);
  494.   }

  496. private:
  497. ‌  void PthreadCall(const char* label, int result) {
  498.     if (result != 0) {
  499.       fprintf(stderr, "pthread %s: %s\n", label, strerror(result));
  500.       abort();
  501.     }
  502.   }

  504.   // BGThread() is the body of the background thread
  505.   void BGThread();
  506. ‌  static void* BGThreadWrapper(void* arg) {
  507.     reinterpret_cast<PosixEnv*>(arg)->BGThread();
  508.     return NULL;
  509.   }

  511.   pthread_mutex_t mu_;
  512.   pthread_cond_t bgsignal_;
  513.   pthread_t bgthread_;
  514.   bool started_bgthread_;

  516.   // Entry per Schedule() call
  517. ‌  struct BGItem { void* arg; void (*function)(void*); };
  518. ‌  typedef std::deque<BGItem> BGQueue;
  519.   BGQueue queue_;

  521.   PosixLockTable locks_;
  522.   MmapLimiter mmap_limit_;
  523. };

  525. ‌PosixEnv::PosixEnv() : started_bgthread_(false) {
  526.   PthreadCall("mutex_init", pthread_mutex_init(&mu_, NULL));
  527.   PthreadCall("cvar_init", pthread_cond_init(&bgsignal_, NULL));
  528. }

  530. ‌void PosixEnv::Schedule(void (*function)(void*), void* arg) {
  531.   PthreadCall("lock", pthread_mutex_lock(&mu_));

  533.   // Start background thread if necessary
  534.   if (!started_bgthread_) {
  535.     started_bgthread_ = true;
  536.     PthreadCall(
  537.         "create thread",
  538.         pthread_create(&bgthread_, NULL,  &PosixEnv::BGThreadWrapper, this));
  539.   }

  541.   // If the queue is currently empty, the background thread may currently be
  542.   // waiting.
  543.   if (queue_.empty()) {
  544.     PthreadCall("signal", pthread_cond_signal(&bgsignal_));
  545.   }

  547.   // Add to priority queue
  548.   queue_.push_back(BGItem());
  549.   queue_.back().function = function;
  550.   queue_.back().arg = arg;

  552.   PthreadCall("unlock", pthread_mutex_unlock(&mu_));
  553. }

  555. ‌void PosixEnv::BGThread() {
  556.   while (true) {
  557.     // Wait until there is an item that is ready to run
  558.     PthreadCall("lock", pthread_mutex_lock(&mu_));
  559.     while (queue_.empty()) {
  560.       PthreadCall("wait", pthread_cond_wait(&bgsignal_, &mu_));
  561.     }

  563.     void (*function)(void*) = queue_.front().function;
  564.     void* arg = queue_.front().arg;
  565.     queue_.pop_front();

  567.     PthreadCall("unlock", pthread_mutex_unlock(&mu_));
  568.     (*function)(arg);
  569.   }
  570. }

  572. namespace {
  573. ‌struct StartThreadState {
  574.   void (*user_function)(void*);
  575.   void* arg;
  576. };
  577. }
  578. ‌static void* StartThreadWrapper(void* arg) {
  579.   StartThreadState* state = reinterpret_cast<StartThreadState*>(arg);
  580.   state->user_function(state->arg);
  581.   delete state;
  582.   return NULL;
  583. }

  585. ‌void PosixEnv::StartThread(void (*function)(void* arg), void* arg) {
  586.   pthread_t t;
  587.   StartThreadState* state = new StartThreadState;
  588.   state->user_function = function;
  589.   state->arg = arg;
  590.   PthreadCall("start thread",
  591.               pthread_create(&t, NULL,  &StartThreadWrapper, state));
  592. }

  594. }  // namespace

  596. static pthread_once_t once = PTHREAD_ONCE_INIT;
  597. static Env* default_env;
  598. ‌static void InitDefaultEnv() { default_env = new PosixEnv; }

  600. ‌Env* Env::Default() {
  601.   pthread_once(&once, InitDefaultEnv);
  602.   return default_env;
  603. }

  605. }  // namespace leveldb
